questions.prompt: In a CSP, what is a constraint?
options: A restriction on the values variables can simultaneously take
The set of possible values for a variable
The order in which variables are assigned
The goal state
questions.correctAnswer: A restriction on the values variables can simultaneously take
questions.explanation: Constraints specify which combinations of variable values are permitted, e.g., "X â‰  Y" for map coloring.

options: For each value in a variables domain, there exists a consistent value in each neighbors domain
All constraints are satisfied
A solution exists
All variables have the same domain size
questions.correctAnswer: For each value in a variables domain, there exists a consistent value in each neighbors domain
questions.explanation: AC-3 makes each arc (directed constraint) consistent by removing domain values that have no supporting values in constrained variables.

questions.prompt: The Minimum Remaining Values (MRV) heuristic chooses:
options: The variable with the fewest legal values remaining
The variable with the most constraints
The first unassigned variable
The variable with the most remaining values
questions.correctAnswer: The variable with the fewest legal values remaining
questions.explanation: MRV (most constrained variable) chooses the variable most likely to cause failure soon, detecting failures early and reducing search.

options: For each value in a variables domain, there exists a consistent value in each neighbors domain
All constraints are satisfied
A solution exists
All variables have the same domain size
questions.correctAnswer: For each value in a variables domain, there exists a consistent value in each neighbors domain
questions.explanation: AC-3 makes each arc (directed constraint) consistent by removing domain values that have no supporting values in constrained variables.

questions.prompt: The Minimum Remaining Values (MRV) heuristic chooses:
options: The variable with the fewest legal values remaining
The variable with the most constraints
The first unassigned variable
The variable with the most remaining values
questions.correctAnswer: The variable with the fewest legal values remaining
questions.explanation: MRV (most constrained variable) chooses the variable most likely to cause failure soon, detecting failures early and reducing search.

options: Removes inconsistent values from unassigned variables after each assignment
Checks all constraints before starting search
Looks ahead to detect solutions
Uses arc consistency on all variables
questions.correctAnswer: Removes inconsistent values from unassigned variables after each assignment
questions.explanation: Forward checking propagates constraints immediately after each assignment, removing values from unassigned neighbors that conflict.

options: Uses local search by changing one variable to minimize constraint violations
Uses backtracking with forward checking
Guarantees finding a solution
Maintains arc consistency
questions.correctAnswer: Uses local search by changing one variable to minimize constraint violations
questions.explanation: Min-conflicts is a local search method that repeatedly selects a conflicting variable and changes it to minimize total conflicts.

options: Removes inconsistent values from unassigned variables after each assignment
Checks all constraints before starting search
Looks ahead to detect solutions
Uses arc consistency on all variables
questions.correctAnswer: Removes inconsistent values from unassigned variables after each assignment
questions.explanation: Forward checking propagates constraints immediately after each assignment, removing values from unassigned neighbors that conflict.

options: Uses local search by changing one variable to minimize constraint violations
Uses backtracking with forward checking

questions.correctAnswer: Uses local search by changing one variable to minimize constraint violations
questions.explanation: Min-conflicts is a local search method that repeatedly selects a conflicting variable and changes it to minimize total conflicts.

options: Preconditions, add list, and delete list
Only preconditions
States and actions
Goals and subgoals
questions.correctAnswer: Preconditions, add list, and delete list
questions.explanation: STRIPS operators specify preconditions (what must be true to apply), add list (what becomes true), and delete list (what becomes false).
